Similar protests occurred across Europe, targeting airports in Finland, Norway, Switzerland, and Spain. Legal actions were planned against the activists.
title: Climate protest at Frankfurt Airport forces a temporary halt to flights
Climate change causing UK temperature extremes: Meteorologists

text: Kyrgyzstan approved a deal with Russia to clean up radioactive sites from Soviet-era mining to ensure public safety. The removal of 55 tonnes of toxic rocket fuel near Bishkek further reduces environmental risks. Rosatom, along with EU and World Bank backing, supports these efforts.
title: Russia and Kyrgyzstan sign radioactive decontamination deal

text: Brazil's federal workers' strike impacts Amazon protection and oil permitting. A planned slowdown will extend until COP30 in Belem, 2025. Petrobras faces a 200,000 barrels/day loss. Lula's government criticized after Bolsonaro’s rollbacks. Superior Court of Justice ordered resumption of licensing and forest fire prevention activities. Union Ascema demands higher wages.
title: Brazil environmental workers propose deal to end strike holding up oil permits
Frozen treats, cold showers and lots of ice; Florida zoo works to protect animals from summer heat

text: University of Delaware and Argonne scientists, led by Kayser and Kaphan, converted Styrofoam to PEDOT: PSS using 1,3-Disulfonic acid imidazolium chloride. They optimized reactions using various conditions, verified by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy. Their eco-friendly polymer matched commercial equivalents, using stoichiometric ratios, offering broader sustainability applications.
title: Study finds how plastic waste can be converted to electronic devices

text: UP CM Adityanath announced planting 36 crore saplings for PM Modi's World Environment Day campaign. Floods impacted 24 districts, temperatures hit 47-50 degrees. 25,000 farmers benefit from BJP's seven-year, 168 crore saplings effort with a 200 crore grant. Saumitra forest in Akbarnagar combats pollution. Carbon credits for Shakti forest under 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' provided by global institutions.
title: UP govt to plant over 36 crore saplings across the state, says CM
New Zealand: 'World's rarest whale' washes ashore
Scientists find climate change disrupting time more than previously thought

text: As global temperatures rise, melting ice sheets at Earth's poles are lengthening the planet's day at an unprecedented rate, a new study reveals. This phenomenon, driven by climate change-induced sea-level rise, alters Earth's shape and slows its rotation. Researchers warn that if emissions persist, the increase in day length could more than double by the century's end, underscoring the profound impact of climate change on planetary dynamics.
title: Melting ice sheets lengthen Earth's days at unprecedented rate, Nasa study finds

text: Authorities warn of severe water shortages in Greece following the warmest winter and earliest heatwave on record. The Mornos reservoir's levels have dropped 30 percent. Athens, home to 3.7 million people, is on "yellow alert" to reduce water consumption. The influx of tourists, poor management, and climate change exacerbate the crisis.
title: Greece fears water shortages after warmest winter ever
Things to know about heat deaths as a dangerously hot summer shapes up in the western US
170 kgs rescued sea turtle 'Bubba' returns to ocean after rehabilitation
Forest deep mountain high
US forecasts delay in La Nina; may not impact monsoon

text: In Palpite, Cuba, 'The House of the Hummingbirds,' Bernabe Hernandez's garden attracts tourists and bee hummingbirds, listed as near-threatened with around 22,000-60,000 individuals. The garden enables breeding, hosts Cuban Emeralds, and features mango, guava, and avocado trees. Guides, aiding with feeders, and revival post-Hurricane Michelle, bolster the hummingbirds' survival.
title: In Cuba, a haven for the world's tiniest bird

text: Shocking environmental crime in Bangladesh as 26 people face charges for destroying vital mangrove forests to make way for shrimp and salt farms. Officials from the ruling Awami League party are implicated. Climate change impact worsens as ecosystem loss threatens coastal protection. International concern as world's mangrove ecosystems at risk of collapse.
title: Bangladesh charges 26 for destruction of vast mangrove forest
Warming Baltic Sea: A red flag for global oceans
The earth is getting hotter, so why is this summer so dismal?

text: Delhi witnessed heavy rains and thunderstorms, causing waterlogging and traffic disruptions. The India Meteorological Department predicted more rainfall in the National Capital Region. Traffic police issued advisories for diversions and alternative routes due to waterlogging and overturned vehicles.
title: Heavy rains in Delhi cause roadblocks, waterlogging; IMD predicts more showers, police issue traffic advisory

text: Moderate rainfall in Gurgaon caused extensive power outages and flooding due to clogged drains. Residents faced basement flooding and vehicle damage. IMD forecasts more showers and thunderstorms till July 28. Delhi experienced light rain and increased humidity later in the day.
title: Showers bring respite from humidity in Gurgaon, but spark hours-long outages, flooding

text: More than 3,000 government hospital doctors in Haryana commenced an indefinite strike, demanding the creation of a separate cadre for specialists, reduction of bond amounts, internal promotions for senior medical officers, and a dynamic ACP scheme. Contingency plans involving retired doctors, medical students, and paramedics ensured that initial OPD services were unaffected. Health Minister Kamal Gupta indicated that the proposal to reduce the bond amount was forwarded for further consideration.
title: Healing the divide: Over 3,000 Haryana govt doctors on the edge

text: Gurgaon police arrested a man in Nuh's Chandka village for allegedly cheating a Rapido bike rider out of Rs 6,000 using a fake SMS. In a separate incident, three men were arrested for robbing another Rapido driver of his bike and cell phone in Gurgaon on July 21.
title: Fraud cheats man with fake UPI credit SMS, nabbed in Haryana's Nuh

text: A special NIA court has denied bail to Gurgaon bodybuilder and influencer Bobby Kataria, implicated in a human trafficking case. Kataria and his associates allegedly offered jobs abroad but forced victims to work for cybercriminals. The court cited the seriousness of the charges and ongoing investigations for denying bail.
title: Probe shows Bobby complicit in human trafficking: NIA court

text: A Gurgaon court acquitted an assistant sub-inspector and two others of murder conspiracy charges due to a lack of evidence. ASI Raj Singh was accused of plotting with two criminals to kill sub-inspector Raj Kumar. The charges arose after Surender alias Sunda allegedly disclosed the plot during an interrogation. However, Kumar later denied having enmity with Singh, and no money was recovered. The court ruled the prosecution failed to prove the conspiracy, leading to the acquittal of the accused.
title: Gurgaon court acquits ASI and two others in murder conspiracy case

text: The GMDA enforcement wing undertook a demolition drive in Old Gurgaon due to complaints from residents about illegal encroachments causing traffic and pedestrian issues. The operation cleared encroachments from 350 shops, removing 12 tea stalls, 12 temporary shops, and 38 jhuggis. Police issued challans to 22 wrongly parked vehicles. Licensed vendors were not disturbed. Warnings were given to prevent re-encroachment, and 250 meters of fencing was begun on the GMDA green belt. The drive aimed to improve traffic management and pedestrian safety.
title: GMDA demolition drive clears illegal encroachments in Gurgaon's sector 4
'Trash' talk: Congress MP calls out BJP over garbage woes in Gurgaon and Faridabad

text: A five-year-old boy's death in BPTP Park Serene highlighted inadequate safety oversight at swimming pools, which are now self-certified for licensing. Residents criticized lifeguard qualifications and lenient inspections, urging stricter enforcement.
title: Pool safety, protocols self-certified after rule change three years ago in Gurgaon

text: A 5-year-old boy drowned at BPTP Park Serene's pool in Gurgaon while lifeguards ignored the situation. They lacked proper training, leading to their arrest for negligence. The boy's family filed a complaint. The developer and maintenance agency face scrutiny.
title: 5-year-old boy drowns in Gurgaon's housing society swimming pool; guards were 'busy on phone'

text: Seven shops at the DLF-1 rapid rail station were sealed by the HSVP due to non-payment of rent. Orders were issued by the chief administrator following a court ruling in HSVP's favor. Another 11 shops across four rapid rail stations will also be sealed for similar reasons.
title: Rent dues mount, stores at Gurgaon's rapid rail station sealed

text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation penalized 1,647 individuals for creating a nuisance on metro premises from April to June, marking a 3% increase from the previous year. Penalties included actions such as making reels, sitting on the train floor, and eating inside trains.
title: DMRC books over 1,600 people for creating nuisance, including making reels, on metro premises

text: Go birding in Gurgaon this monsoon.
title: ‘Monsoon is a great time to go birding in Gurgaon’s many natural habitats’

text: A man previously convicted of child abuse was arrested in Madhya Pradesh for allegedly sexually assaulting two children in Gurgaon and MP. After his release in 2015, he continued such offenses. Police used CCTV footage and conducted raids before arresting him. He confessed to several crimes, including abusing a family member and two women while frequently changing locations.
title: Man who sexually assaulted 2 minors 4 months ago held

text: Gurgaon police arrested Ajay and Sanjay for allegedly killing 24-year-old labourer Sanoj, who was found dead with multiple injuries in Shikohpur on July 20. Ajay suspected an affair between Sanoj and his wife. The body was identified by Sanoj's family. A case was registered and the auto rickshaw used in the crime was recovered.
title: Gurgaon man bludgeons labourer (24) to death; arrested with friend

text: Sandeep Singh, a security guard left in a vegetative state after a hit-and-run accident in Gurgaon, received Rs 92 lakh in compensation from a Motor Accident Claims Tribunal. Singh's mother petitioned for Rs 2 crore. The sum will support Singh's medical care. The driver was arrested for negligent driving and later released on bail.
title: Victim awarded Rs 92 lakh in Gurgaon hit-and-run case

text: The Punjab and Haryana high court imposed a Rs 50,000 fine on MCG for assigning an unversed person in a prohibited pet breed case. The court requested necessary details by August 27.
title: Prohibited pet breeds in Gurgaon, Haryana HC tells MCG to cough up Rs 50k fine

text: A Gurgaon man was sentenced to 20 years for raping his 8-year-old neighbor in 2021. The court ordered Rs 5 lakh as compensation for the minor. Evidence and witness testimonies solidified the case. The victim identified the accused, leading to a swift conviction by the court.
title: Man handed 20 years' RI for raping girl (8) in 2021

text: Residents of Ardee City in Gurgaon faced issues after a contractor stopped work on a 1km road project, causing concerns over safety due to waterlogging. The contractor ceased operations after one day, leaving the road partially excavated. Officials confirmed that the project is on schedule and will be completed by the August 16 deadline.
title: Gurgaon contractor digs up road, leaves work midway, commute a nightmare now

text: The hantavirus, transmitted via rodents, recently caused four deaths in the U.S. Symptoms initially include fatigue and fever, progressing to severe respiratory complications. Prevention focuses on reducing exposure to rodent urine and droppings. As per a research study, the first hantavirus isolate to be cultured, Thottapalayam virus, is the only indigenous isolate from India, isolated from an insectivore in 1964 in Vellore, South India.
title: Hantavirus: Are there cases in India as well?

text: Green tea, honey water, and haldi (turmeric) water each have unique benefits for morning beauty routines. Green tea aids metabolism, honey water provides energy and hydration, and haldi water offers anti-inflammatory effects and immunity boosts. Choose based on personal health goals and taste preferences.
title: What should be your morning beauty drink?

text: Riti Shah chose a pastel lavender lehenga designed by Sabyasachi Mukherjee for her wedding, aligning with the latest trend in bridal fashion. Paired with jadau jewelry and minimalistic makeup, her look reflected a modern yet traditional elegance, deviating from the classic red hues.
title: Sabyasachi bride ditches red for lavender

text: India's rich ice cream heritage has gained global recognition, with five Indian varieties making it to Taste Atlas' list of the world's 100 most iconic ice creams. Leading the list is Mumbai's K. Rustom & Co. with its beloved mango ice cream sandwich. Bengaluru’s Corner House and its "Death by Chocolate" sundae also secured a spot. Other featured treats include Natural Ice Cream's tender coconut, Apsara Ice Creams' guava flavor, and Mangaluru’s Pabba’s Gadbad. These unique and delicious ice creams showcase India's diverse culinary landscape and have captured the hearts of dessert lovers worldwide.
title: Indian brands in "World's 100 most iconic ice creams"

text: While most of us want to be more productive and efficient, many people end up procrastinating. So, here we list down 10 effective ways to help you work smarter, not harder.
title: 10 ways to work smarter, not harder

text: Ever wondered if those satellites dotting the night sky can actually fall back to Earth? Surprisingly, they can. Despite appearing permanent, satellites orbiting our planet can experience decay over time due to factors like atmospheric drag. This process can lead to their eventual re-entry into Earth's atmosphere, sometimes resulting in spectacular events. Explore how these man-made marvels can return to Earth's surface, often burning up but occasionally leaving debris that makes landfall, prompting us to rethink our relationship with space above us.
title: Can an artificial satellite fall on Earth?

text: Researchers have found a novel way to detect deepfakes by analyzing reflections in the eyes of subjects in images. Presented at a conference in Hull, UK, this method leverages astronomy techniques to assess the consistency of light reflections, distinguishing between real and AI-generated images with 70% accuracy. While promising, the approach requires refinement to minimize false detections. This breakthrough marks a significant step in combating digital misinformation in an era dominated by advanced AI technologies.
title: Explained: How to spot a deepfake picture

text: Dr. Michael Roizen, 78, maintains a biological age of 57.6 through dietary habits. He follows the longevity and Mediterranean diets, practices intermittent fasting, and prioritizes lunch as the main meal. The longevity diet is more than just a trend; it's a lifestyle approach aimed at enhancing healthspan—the length of time you live in good health. Central to this diet is the idea of calorie restriction without malnutrition.
title: 78 yr old doctor reverses age by 22 yrs; Know how

text: World Umami Day, celebrated on July 25th, honors umami, the fifth taste discovered in 1908 by Kikunae Ikeda. Chef Ajay Chopra discusses using umami in Indian cuisine to elevate flavors. The article includes tips to enhance umami and a recipe for Indori Poha with Jeeravan Masala.
title: The Umami Factor: How the fifth taste redefines food

text: According to legends and beliefs, Lord Vishnu rests on the Shesha nag in the Kshir Sagar and asks the other Gods to take over the functioning of the Universe.

text: ​Akshay Kumar's fitness inspires youngsters who are decades younger to him. The 56 year old has a strict fitness routine which he follows religiously.​

text: The article discusses the use of optical illusions to determine one's hidden love language by observing an image. Depending on whether you see an eagle, men on horses, or mountains first, the illusion reveals if you approach love with caution, affection, or compassion. This unique approach helps understand emotional aspects associated with relationships.
title: Personality Test: What is your hidden love language?

text: Dhruv Rathee, a prominent Indian YouTuber and activist, faces a defamation suit for criticizing BJP Mumbai spokesperson Suresh Karamshi Nakhua in a viral video. Known for his incisive political commentary and social advocacy, Rathee's journey from engineering student to influential media figure underscores his role in shaping public discourse on Indian politics and social issues. Despite legal challenges, Rathee remains committed to fostering transparency and accountability through his content, resonating widely with a global audience.
title: Who is Dhruv Rathee, the Youtuber who is trending

text: Astronomers, with participation from IIT Kanpur, have discovered Epsilon Indi Ab, a massive exoplanet six times the size of Jupiter, using the James Webb Space Telescope. The planet is 12 light-years away. The research team aims to explore its atmospheric composition and climatology.
title: IIT Kanpur Prof in the team to discover Super-Jupiter

text: Expecting actress Deepika Padukone posted a photo of herself doing Viparita Karani, a yoga pose, on Instagram. She highlighted its benefits during pregnancy, like reducing heaviness and swelling. The article elaborated on other advantageous yoga poses and safety tips for pregnant women. Yoga's positive effects on mental and physical health during pregnancy were underscored.
title: Deepika Padukone highly recommends this yoga

text: Historically, diverse cultures linked foot shapes and toe sizes with personality traits. High-arched feet indicated ambition, flat feet reliability. Roman, square, and Greek foot types, along with toe lengths, were believed to reveal various characteristics, offering insights into individuals.
title: What foot shapes say about one's personality

text: Milk is nutrient-rich and benefits vary by the time of day it is consumed. Morning intake boosts energy and controls appetite, while night consumption aids sleep and muscle recovery. Effects can vary based on individual tolerance, causing possible inflammation or bloating. Consumption time should match personal health goals.
title: Is drinking milk in morning healthier than night?

text: Building a deep connection with your children requires effort, patience, and genuine interest in their lives. By adding these unique and interesting ways into your daily interactions, you can create a loving and supportive environment that fosters a strong and lasting bond.
title: 10 ways to deeply connect with your children

text: Pairing tea or coffee with specific foods like citrus fruits, spicy foods, and dairy products can lead to digestive issues. This article outlines eight such foods and their effects when combined with tea or coffee. Avoid these to enhance your beverage experience.

text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin accused PM Narendra Modi of prioritizing government survival over national interest in the Union Budget. Calling for impartial governance, Stalin criticized Modi's seemingly vindictive stance against opposition states. MP Dayanidhi Maran supported Stalin, urging Modi to serve all citizens. INDIA bloc leaders protested the budget's favoritism toward certain states.
title: 'You will end up isolated': MK Stalin's warning to PM Modi after Union Budget

text: Mallikarjun Kharge leveled allegations against the BJP-led government on Wednesday, claiming that the Union Budget for 2024-25 exhibited favoritism towards only two states, namely Bihar and Andhra Pradesh, at the expense of the remaining states in the country. Kharge spearheaded the criticism against this alleged bias, characterizing the budget as a "kursi-bachao" document, suggesting that it was designed to safeguard the ruling party's political interests rather than addressing the nation's needs as a whole.
title: ‘Mataji bolne mein toh expert hain’: Kharge attacks Sitharaman during Budget debate in Rajya Sabha

text: From October 1, individuals domiciled in India will need a clearance certificate under the Black Money Act before leaving the country. This outlines a tightened regulation to ensure all tax liabilities are clear.
title: Departing from India? Clearance certificate under Black Money Act required

text: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has taken the lead in preparations for upcoming byelections to 10 assembly seats, expected to be held later this year. He has formed a team of ministers to look after preparations even before the BJP organisation has started its own groundwork. This proactive approach has surprised many but analysts believe the outcome of the bypolls, after the party's lacklustre showing in the Lok Sabha elections, will have a direct impact on Yogi's image, and hence he is leading from the front.
title: Yogi Adityanath's proactive approach surprises many: Amid talk of rift, CM moves ahead of party in UP bypoll preparations

text: Abhishek Banerjee, TMC leader and Diamond Harbour MP, joined opposition INDIA bloc leaders on Wednesday to criticise the Union Budget, describing it as "anti-people" and aimed at "appeasing and compensating" BJP allies in the NDA. Banerjee criticised the BJP government sharply. "B in budget stood for betrayal, U for unemployment, D for deprived, G for Guarantee (Zero warranty) E for Eccentric T for Tragedy," he said.
title: 'Budget stands for ...': TMC's Abhishek stirs up big storm in Lok Sabha

text: Anil Deshmukh, ex-Maharashtra home minister, alleged that Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis pressured him into filing false affidavits against MVA leaders to destabilize the government. Deshmukh claimed offers were made to halt probes against him. Fadnavis denied the allegations, indicating he possesses incriminating evidence and warning to disclose it if the accusations continue.
title: ‘Devendra Fadnavis pressured me to file false affidavits against Thackerays’

text: 24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting died during a Mukbang livestream on July 14. Known for consuming up to 10 kg of food in marathon sessions, she weighed 300 kg at the time of her death. Her extreme eating habits, despite family warnings, led to severe health issues. Her tragic death highlights the dangers of Mukbang and influencer pressures.
title: 24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting dies during livestream Mukbang session

text: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are conducting experiments on watering plants in microgravity while stranded in space due to spacecraft issues. They are also studying the effects of microgravity on the human body. Engineers are working to resolve the technical problems as the astronauts continue their research.
title: As NASA's Boeing Starliner remains stuck in space, Astronaut Sunita Williams busies herself in new research

text: ​Princess Kalina of Bulgaria is aware of the attention that her ripped physique garners and said that a woman's physical form should not be worthy of news in the 21st century. In an interview to a Spanish publication, the Bulgarian royal said she does not feel well if she does not train.
title: 70 kg back pull, 20 kg biceps curl: Princess Kalina's fitness regime will make your head spin

text: Moderate to intense rain with wind speeds up to 60 km/h hit Mumbai causing Vihar Lake to overflow. Waterlogging led to multiple bus diversions, and the Andheri Subway was shut down. A tree fell near Matoshree Bungalow, disrupting more bus routes.
title: Mumbai rain: Lakes overflowing, trees uprooted, Andheri subway closed; IMD predicts intense showers ahead

text: Google introduced six new features for Google Maps in India, focusing on AI-driven enhancements and local partnerships. Updates include narrow road avoidance, flyover navigation, metro ticket booking, EV charging station data, curated recommendations, and improved user-generated content. The features aim to address common commuter issues and promote sustainable travel, rolling out gradually across major cities.

text: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority fined J Kumar Infraprojects Rs 50 lakh for potholes on the BKC-LBS Marg flyover arm. An additional Rs 10 lakh per day fine will apply until repairs are completed. Notices were also issued to project consultants and MMRDA personnel. This is a recurring issue for the contractor on the same project.
title: Contractor fined Rs 50 lakh for huge potholes on Mumbai's Santacruz-Chembur Link Road extension

text: A fire in the 22-storey Kanakia Samarpan Tower in Borivli East led to the death of a 70-year-old resident and injured three others. The building lacked a functional firefighting system. Over 100 residents were rescued by fire officials. The fire is suspected to have started in the electrical duct between the seventh and eighth floors.
title: 70-year-old dies in fire in Mumbai's Borivli highrise, 3 hurt

text: Heavy rainfall hit Mumbai and surrounding regions, causing severe disruption. Two people were swept away in Badlapur's Barvi Dam backwaters. Multiple agencies launched a search. Mumbai's infrastructure struggled with waterlogging, traffic congestion, and accidents. Rainfall reached up to 200mm in outer regions, significantly affecting daily life and transport systems. No major injuries were reported.
title: Triple-digit rain lashes Mumbai Metropolitan Region, 2 swept away; two lakes supplying city overflow, 10% water cut goes next week

text: The Shinde government's new Mukhya Mantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana will cost Rs 46,000 crore annually, offering a Rs 1,500 monthly stipend to poor women. Approved despite financial concerns, the scheme mimics Madhya Pradesh's successful Ladli Behna Yojana and has pushed Maharashtra's debt projection to Rs 7.8 lakh crore.
tags: Mukhya Mantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana
title: Maharashtra's Ladki Bahin scheme cleared despite concerns by finance department

text: The BMC declared that all Mumbai schools and colleges would operate as usual after weather conditions stabilized. Conversely, Raigad closed educational institutions following heavy rainfall alerts. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde reviewed the situation and pledged support for flood-affected residents. Varying weather alerts were issued for Mumbai and surrounding regions.
title: Mumbai rains: BMC declares schools, colleges to operate normally today

text: The skies opened up over the city and MMR region from the early hours of Thursday, bringing the season's heaviest downpour so far. Two of the lakes, Vihar and Modak Sagar, that supply water to Mumbai began to overflow, prompting BMC to announce that it would lift the existing water cut from July 29. But the city's rickety infrastructure quickly went down on its knees, with reports of traffic congestion owing to waterlogging and potholes.

text: Four members of an Indian-origin family lost their lives in a fire that engulfed their home in Abbassia, Kuwait on Friday night. text: Indian techie Siddhant Vitthal Patil, 26, is presumed drowned in Glacier National Park. He texted his mother before the incident. Siddhant's parents, Priti and Vitthal, who retired from Maharashtra's irrigation department in May, are in shock and unable to speak. Leaders from Maharashtra, including Sharad Pawar and Devendra Fadnavis, have requested the government's help. text: A series of earthquakes, including a magnitude 4.9 tremor, hit Scurry County, West Texas, on Monday. Experts link the quakes to local oil production methods, specifically enhanced oil recovery. This process involves injecting water or carbon dioxide into oil fields, which can induce seismic activity. The recent quakes highlight a rise in earthquake frequency due to these methods.
title: Texas rocked by multiple earthquakes: What’s causing the shaking?

text: California governor Gavin Newsom has ordered the dismantling of thousands of homeless encampments following a Supreme Court ruling granting governments broader removal powers. The directive, applying to state agencies, aims to address health and safety threats but has sparked debate. Critics argue it fails to tackle the root causes of homelessness and may exacerbate the issue.

text: Wildfires have devastated the Canadian town of Jasper, destroying up to half of the community and forcing the evacuation of 25,000 people. Triggered by a lightning storm and driven by strong winds, the fires levelled streets and left smouldering ruins. The blaze remains out of control despite global firefighting support and some rain. This disaster highlights severe fire conditions across North America.
title: Devastating wildfires ravage Jasper, Alberta: Mass evacuations and international firefighting efforts
